publication.title: Chronic Skeletal Unloading of the Rat Femur: Mechanisms and Functional Consequences of Vascular Remodeling

results.effect: Lowered blood flow in distal metaphysis, proximal and distal metaphyses, diaphysis, and diaphyseal marrow of HU animals compared to control
Higher vascular resistance in all regions of the femur during reloading in 14-d HU rats
Smaller PNA intraluminal diameter and thinner medial wall thickness in 14-d HU rats compared to control
